svg.text: title: "November 16, 2018" date: "2018-11-16"
News and Links
Layer 1
* [Eth 2.0] What’s New in Eth 2.0
[Eth 2.0] What’s New in Eth 2.0
* [Eth 2.0] implementers call . Agenda
[Eth 2.0] implementers call . Agenda
* [Eth 2.0] Notes from Prague workshop sessions
[Eth 2.0] Notes from Prague workshop sessions
* [Eth 2.0] Prysmatic Labs dev update, first RanDAO implementation, validator key
management, etc

* [Eth 2.0] Who should have to pay storage management fees ?
[Eth 2.0] Who should have to pay storage management fees ?

* [ewasm] ewasm’s roadmap for monthly testnet releases

* [CBC Casper] Barnabé Monnot’s Casper CBC spec explainer part 1 and part 2 . Also, a
visualization of multi-shard system from Vlad.

* Avalanche RanDAO
Avalanche RanDAO
Layer 2
* [State channels] Counterfactual dev update . Monorepo . Specs for state channel
protocol, app library and a minimalist contracts layer
[State channels] Counterfactual dev update . Monorepo . Specs for state channel
* [State channels] Magmo launches rock-paper-scissors app with a channel wallet on
Ropsten using ForceMove framework. Demo link . repo
[State channels] Magmo launches rock-paper-scissors app with a channel wallet on
* [State channels] Raiden v0.17
[State channels] Raiden v0.17
* Blockchain at Berkeley’s Fourth State: Plasma isn’t dead, a rebuttal to Coindesk
article
Blockchain at Berkeley’s Fourth State: Plasma isn’t dead, a rebuttal to Coindesk
* [Plasma] Plasma Cash was a transaction format
[Plasma] Plasma Cash was a transaction format
* [Plasma] Plasma Prime proposal from Bankex
[Plasma] Plasma Prime proposal from Bankex
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.5 - a major breaking release, go read the notes.
Solidity v0.5 - a major breaking release, go read the notes.
* Tutorial: deploying a Loom PlasmaChain app
Tutorial: deploying a Loom PlasmaChain app
* Next 6 months roadmap for 3Box
Next 6 months roadmap for 3Box
* Etherlinker for Unreal Engine 4
Etherlinker for Unreal Engine 4
* Unity and Ethereum starter tutorial
Unity and Ethereum starter tutorial
* Bonding curves explained with code. More (unaudited) code for bonding curve tokens
Bonding curves explained with code. More (unaudited) code for bonding curve tokens
* Grid+ releases SDK for their Lattice agent .
Grid+ releases SDK for their Lattice agent .
* IBM is creating Solidity tutorials for Hyperledger
IBM is creating Solidity tutorials for Hyperledger
* Gateway contracts : code operating on a shared state through the gateway contract
Gateway contracts : code operating on a shared state through the gateway contract
* Academic paper on KEVM
Academic paper on KEVM
* Sojourn dev kit in React - encrypt and store data on IPFS using Shamir’s Secret
Sharing with hash stored onchain
Sojourn dev kit in React - encrypt and store data on IPFS using Shamir’s Secret Sharing
with hash stored onchain
* Resources for developing with Gnosis Safe
Resources for developing with Gnosis Safe
* Austin Griffith: Counterfactual loan repayment or “keyless predictive deployment” and
what Austin is up to at Gitcoin . Related: Jez San comment on the struggles of user
onboarding for FunFair
Austin Griffith: Counterfactual loan repayment or “keyless predictive deployment” and
* How to query balances for all Eth addresses in BigQuery . Dappboard is working on an
ETL pipeline for Eth
How to query balances for all Eth addresses in BigQuery . Dappboard is working on an
* 0x launch kit - start a relayer in “under a minute”
0x launch kit - start a relayer in “under a minute”
* Infura dashboard now has stats
Infura dashboard now has stats
* snarkjs : snark implementation in Javascript from Iden3
snarkjs : snark implementation in Javascript from Iden3
Ecosystem
* A survey of Ethereum based games . Tyler Smith’s tweetstorm on tokenizing game assets
A survey of Ethereum based games . Tyler Smith’s tweetstorm on tokenizing game assets
* The forever weird Ethereum community made ShatnerHodl.com to welcome William Shatner
. And Jonathan Mann wrote a song .
The forever weird Ethereum community made ShatnerHodl.com to welcome William Shatner .
And Jonathan Mann wrote a song .
* Alethio finds a bunch of CryptoKitty inbreeding
Alethio finds a bunch of CryptoKitty inbreeding
* Hour of day gasprice heatmap from Gitcoin
Hour of day gasprice heatmap from Gitcoin
* Rachel O’Leary profiles Swarm’s Daniel Nagy
Rachel O’Leary profiles Swarm’s Daniel Nagy
* Streamr is following Gnosis’ lead in defaulting to web3 products .
Streamr is following Gnosis’ lead in defaulting to web3 products .
* Taylor on lessons learned in the MEW/MyCrypto split – the whole MyCrypto AMA is worth
a read because they put time into it
Taylor on lessons learned in the MEW/MyCrypto split – the whole MyCrypto AMA is worth a
read because they put time into it
Client-related
* Parity v 2.2.1 beta & 2.1.6 stable
Parity v 2.2.1 beta & 2.1.6 stable
* Geth v1.8.18 with Swarm v0.3.6. Big Geth optimization coming ?
Geth v1.8.18 with Swarm v0.3.6. Big Geth optimization coming ?
* Nethermind v0.9.1 .NET Core mainnet clientwith Görli support
Nethermind v0.9.1 .NET Core mainnet clientwith Görli support
* Test suite v6.0.0beta2 ready for Constantinople fork
Test suite v6.0.0beta2 ready for Constantinople fork
* EthereumJS monthly recap
EthereumJS monthly recap
Enterprise
* A survey of blockchain use cases by industry
A survey of blockchain use cases by industry
* Azure blockchain dev kit with Truffle extension for VSCode. Microsoft also recorded a
video chat on dapps with Drizzle
Azure blockchain dev kit with Truffle extension for VSCode. Microsoft also recorded a
* Zug residents get free weekly 20 hours of e-bike usage through uPort . Also Linum
Labs does a trial with Swiss Federal Railways using uPort
Zug residents get free weekly 20 hours of e-bike usage through uPort . Also Linum Labs
does a trial with Swiss Federal Railways using uPort
Governance and Standards
* ERC1577 : Multiaddr for ENS better defined system of mapping names to network and
content addresses
ERC1577 : Multiaddr for ENS better defined system of mapping names to network and
* ERC1576 : Whisper bid negotiation protocol
ERC1576 : Whisper bid negotiation protocol
* ERC1856 : risk redistribution for stable payment
ERC1856 : risk redistribution for stable payment
* ERC1572 : contact card standard
ERC1572 : contact card standard
* Luke Duncan: trust minimized governance tokens
Luke Duncan: trust minimized governance tokens
Project Updates
* Livepeer’s potential Streamflow release - new orchestrator role, no stake minimum to
be a transcoder, and probabilistic micropayments
Livepeer’s potential Streamflow release - new orchestrator role, no stake minimum to be
a transcoder, and probabilistic micropayments
* Brave’s SpeedReader - pre-rendering classifier gives 20x performance improvement, 84x
less bandwidth, 2.4x memory reduction. They also called for a GDPR in the US
Brave’s SpeedReader - pre-rendering classifier gives 20x performance improvement, 84x
* Market Protocol’s MPX lets you trade gold, SP500, crude live on Rinkeby
Market Protocol’s MPX lets you trade gold, SP500, crude live on Rinkeby
* Aragon Q3 dev update and transparency. Also, their first governance vote is ongoing ,
but about to end. Since they launched on mainnet at Devcon, 100+ DAOs have been created
Aragon Q3 dev update and transparency. Also, their first governance vote is ongoing ,
* Subby - censorship resistant newsfeed using Eth and IPFS
Subby - censorship resistant newsfeed using Eth and IPFS
* More than 1% of all ETH is locked in Maker CDPs . Meanwhile, Augur has ~13k ETH in
open interest with a big test of Augur market reporting - is standard prediction
markets terminology enough or does every word get parsed?
More than 1% of all ETH is locked in Maker CDPs . Meanwhile, Augur has ~13k ETH in open
interest with a big test of Augur market reporting - is standard prediction markets
terminology enough or does every word get parsed?
Interviews, Podcasts, Videos, Talks
* Devcon4 main hall talks are all online. Early winners of buzz are Andy Milenius and
Phil Daian.
Devcon4 main hall talks are all online. Early winners of buzz are Andy Milenius and
* Brendan Eich talk at Web Summit
Brendan Eich talk at Web Summit
* Ameen Soleimani on POVCrypto
Ameen Soleimani on POVCrypto
* NEAR protocol ’s Alex and Illia on 51 Percent
NEAR protocol ’s Alex and Illia on 51 Percent
* BreakerMag’s print interview with Vitalik Buterin
BreakerMag’s print interview with Vitalik Buterin
* Alex van de Sande on Hashing It Out
Alex van de Sande on Hashing It Out
Tokens / Business / Regulation
* RadarRelay says it will implement OFAC compliance , though it doesn’t define what
that means. OpenRelay will blacklist security tokens . New relayer Lake Trade is
blocking the US , as Paradex continues to do.
RadarRelay says it will implement OFAC compliance , though it doesn’t define what that
means. OpenRelay will blacklist security tokens . New relayer Lake Trade is blocking
the US , as Paradex continues to do.
* Brooklyn Project on dexes
Brooklyn Project on dexes
* Airfox and Paragon agree SEC settlements to register as securities, pay 250k each
plus refund purchasers. Given the EtherDelta settlement, I would have expected harsher
for these particular cases.
Airfox and Paragon agree SEC settlements to register as securities, pay 250k each plus
refund purchasers. Given the EtherDelta settlement, I would have expected harsher for
these particular cases.
* Simon de la Rouviere’s history of token curves
Simon de la Rouviere’s history of token curves
General
* Understanding consensus algorithms from Preethi Kasireddy
Understanding consensus algorithms from Preethi Kasireddy
* Jordan Clifford’s Bitcoin Cash ABC/SV fork explainer
Jordan Clifford’s Bitcoin Cash ABC/SV fork explainer
* The Winklevoss twins are suing Charlie Shrem
The Winklevoss twins are suing Charlie Shrem
* A roadmap for ZCash’s next release, Blossom
A roadmap for ZCash’s next release, Blossom
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new additions in bold ):
* Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
* Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
* Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
* Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
* Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
* Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
* Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re
interested.
I own Week In Ethereum. As such, editorial control has always been 100% me. If you’re
unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel
free to tweet at me.
Housekeeping and (wi) ETH 10k
I set a goal to grow the subscriber base of this newsletter to 10000 by the end of the
year, so I would be indebted for any and all social network sharing.
Last week I published “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ” if you’re
wondering how I think about newsletter curation.
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
Week in Ethereum News
